On 4/8/10 1:33 PM, Rajkumar wrote:
> hi,
>
> Since we are trying to use heritrix 3.0 api in order to invoke heritrix (using our http client), is there a way to invoke those api's using HTTP than https.
>
> i searched for the documentation in order to convert the https to http but i am not able to find anything.
>
> Can someone please help on how to achieve this?

Are you sure you can't use HTTPS with your HTTP client code? Many HTTP 
client utilities have an SSL option.

We considered, but ultimately did not include in H3, a command-line 
switch to listen for plain HTTP rather than HTTPS.

You could use some combination of other netcat/openssl programs to set 
up a proxy that accepts normal HTTP and forwards to HTTPS. For example, 
using the 'ncat' program that's part of 'nmap', this one-liner on the 
same machine as the crawler sets up such a proxy on port 8008:

% ncat -l 8008 -c "ncat --ssl localhost 8443"

Be sure to review and understand the 'Security Considerations' of the 
Heritrix administrative interface:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Security+Considerations

Note especially that if your crawler operator credentials are 
compromised by any mechanism (observed in transit over unencrypted link; 
failure to verify that SSL connect was with intended server-certificate; 
choice of weak login/password; etc.), then resulting unauthorized access 
to the crawler interface allows an attacker to change files, and run 
arbitrary code, on the crawler machine with the privileges of the user 
account used to the launch the Java VM.

That's why we recommend:

  - pick strong credentials
  - only connect via HTTPS, and verify the expected server certificate
  - use additional redundant mechanisms (listening only for local 
connections; firewall policies) to prevent connections from unexpected 
places

- Gordon @ IA
